reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel, but I would not stay again. Instead of one deal breaker, it was a culmination of a few; location to Portland's downtown, fee for WiFi, and few small things which I would not expect from this price point hotel.
reviews.title: Nice, Not Great...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although not far off the main downtown area, I would have rather been 6 blocks east. Charging a fee for WiFi is low buck, especially since this is not a cheap hotel. I understand the vintage theme of this hotel, and designers goals with the bathrooms, albeit small - but the loud commercial grade tankless toilets - they could suck a football down! Another low buck peeve is the lack of any water in the room, unless you wanted to pay $6 for a bottle.
reviews.title: A tad too shabby to be chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite's view was pretty bad, rooftop bisected the windows allowing us the eye level view of the adjacent rooftop. Again, we have traveled extensively, and are pretty patient regarding things like that. The bed, and pillows were good, and the room was clean.
reviews.title: staff, furnishings & finish exceptional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I stated up front, I most likely will not be staying at this hotel again due to a few small things that added up making me leave with a bad feeling.
reviews.title: First, but not last trip to Portland, OR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow...you sure get a shabby chic look when you come here and in many ways I do mean shabby. From the furniture to the paint colors and the ultra tiny rooms this place is not warm and fuzzy. The "pillow menu" is really a gimmick and the location is not the best in the downtown area. I would rather stay in the Pearl.
reviews.title: Unique boutique and great location...but a bit noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon initial investigation on luxury/near luxury accommodations I came across Hotel deLuxe. I read a few negative reviews and still opted to stay at this institution. Let me preface my following comments with this disclosure, I have stayed at some of the finest hotels/resorts on the globe including (but not limited to): The Four Seasons Gresham Palace (Budapest), Ritz Carlton (Dallas/Buckhead/Central Park), Four Seasons (Atlanta & Seattle), Peninsula (Chicago/Tokyo) etc. and found this a comparable property. As far as accoutrements it had everything I anticipated. Most hotels/motels charge for Wi-Fi, doesn't matter if they are $900 a night rooms. The staff was friendly & attentive. This is an OLD building but has been RECENTLY redone, if you want a new hotel feel opt for elsewhere. Old hotels are NOTORIOUSLY smaller than their newer counterparts; that being said I found the room comfortable and the infrastructure more than satisfactory. As far as location, make sure that you examine what you want to do in Portland before you book ANY hotel room. I found this hotel close enough to everything without being in and amongst the hullabaloo/traffic. I found it very accessible, please keep in mind Portland is a city meant to be WALKED not driven. Plenty of access to public transit
reviews.title: Excellent hotel & staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time at the Hotel de Luxe for a 3 night stay. We had a King Feature room, which was a very large corner room and an exceptionally comfortable bed! Also, we used the AAA rate which also included free parking. I thought all the staff was very friendly and helpful in giving us directions and recommending places to eat. I see that other reviews felt that the hotel was too far from Portland's downtown; however, I found Portland to be a very walkable city with short blocks. Transit is also available and easy to follow. We loved our trip to Portland, and felt that Hotel de luxe was a wonderful city hotel.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel With Fantastic Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love this place. We live in Portland but will stay here 3-4 times/year for a stay-cation. Rooms are fully equipped: bathrobes, coffee, snacks! the restaurants in the hotel are wonderful and the staff is very friendly. Oh yah, they also have a pillow menu!
reviews.title: Great Portland Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Portland and the Hotel deLuxe (and staff) made it a great experience. The hotel is 100 years old, but had a recent makeover and now has an art deco movie themed appearance. The hotel lobby and Driftwood Bar are a must to see, even if you stay somewhere else. The rooms were very nicely appointed. They were on the small side, but very comfortable and thoughtfully designed. The only downside is that there is no pool, but that wasn't a must 100 years ago! The staff are fantastic. Very attentive, knowledgeable, and accommodating. And the price point was very competitive. I also liked the location which was a few blocks out of the main city core, so a little quieter. We walked or took the Portland transit everywhere. Most Portland highlights are within 20 minutes walk.
reviews.title: Overall great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not one to give a bad review but this place was just awful. Our room was TINY, without even a space to put our luggage down. There was a step up into the bathroom which was dangerous when you're half asleep in the middle of the night and need to use the restroom.
reviews.title: HORRIBLE stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel deLuxe for 2 nights on a recent trip to the West Coast. We booked the room initially after reading TA reviews, and deciding to 'splurge' a bit and stay walkable to downtown rather than across the river. The hotel was very walkable, the rooms were exceptional - the beds were so comfortable that we didn't want to leave. We enjoyed the movie theme of the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful time at the Hotel deLuxe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: $19 to park overnight in the hotel garage next door (slightly more for valet, but that gives you in/out access to your car for the flat rate) - we parked overnight one night, but after a day trip to Mount Hood, found that street parking works well too.
reviews.title: a quiet, comfortable city stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Great stay, a treasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great location, exceptional service, good price point for a city stay
reviews.title: A step back into time when elegence was at it's best!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in this downtown hotel. It was very convenient and fixed up elegantly. It has sort of a 'golden age of movies' theme. Staff is extremely knowledgable and helpful. Restaurants they recommended were excellent. Valet parking staff is super nice and prompt. Our room was cozy but elegant. If you want unique and historic and slightly off the beaten path, this is a good bet.
reviews.title: Luxury hotel in a prime downtown location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff really makes this hotel work. As a property it's a bit older, but in great shape. The rooms are very stylish and yes, they are a bit small. We didn't spend much time in the hotel so for our purposes this was a great choice. Quiet location. Steps away from the MAX line providing direct (and inexpensive) transportation to the airport. This hotel does a lot of the little things right. It's designed with discerning travellers in mind. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Hotel Deluxe is truly just that-a deluxe experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I recently traveled to Portland to help my niece get settled for college so I needed a hotel that was close to her apt. & school. I also wanted someplace in a safe neighborhood & walking distance to everything! I thought that might be a tall order but then I found The deLuxe.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everything was just great right from the beginning. The staff were some of the nicest, friendliest, most helpful people I've ever met. The room was very pleasant and quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in all respects

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I had dinner & breakfast in the hotel restaurant, "Gracie's", and found the food to be absolutely delicious. The fellow who parked my car and was really helpful in giving me directions whenever I needed them and also suggested an alternative route to the airport which saved me some time.(Mapquest's directions were confusing!)
reviews.title: A Delight!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The folks at the front desk suggested several excellent restaurants a short walk from the hotel for other meals.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Deluxe and weren't disappointed. Lovely kitsch decor, friendly staff and good quality breakfast. The Concierge could not have been more helpful and the room was compact and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. The location, the rooms, the staff the amenities all were like a luxury hotel with a much lower price. We stayed for two nights and then traveled around Oregon and came back for one more night. Both stays were consistently excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Hotel deLuxe. It is conveniently located near public transportation, but really downtown Portland is a walkable city and we didn't use our car at all. The hotel is very near Powell's bookstore, a real draw for us. This is an older hotel that has been refurbished but retains that old world feeling. The floors are themed around old movies: our floor paid homage to Alfred Hitchcock with many large stills from his movies. The floor above was dancers--Fred Astaire, Gene Kelly, etc. Our room was very comfortable with a large closet. It was quiet with lovely bedding. The restaurant is good, as is the happy hour (starts at 2 p.m.!) The service is first rate--they made sure a request on bedding was fulfilled prior to our arrival, and staff were uniformly efficient and welcoming. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was chosen as one of the hotels for guests of a friend's wedding so we were fortunate to have a slightly discounted rate. Clearly, the hotel is used frequently by wedding parties since we saw at least 4 brides over the course of 2 days. The room is very clean and nicely appointed. Our room (#314) was very small (esp. for $170/night!) and had a view of nothing, but, again nicely appointed and comfy bed. Front desk very helpful with questions about locale and getting around. The little Driftwood Bar and its bartender were a bit pretentious. The bar is practically pitch black inside but I was given a flashlight to read the menu! "Happy Hour" means 1/2 price champagne cocktails and a choice of 1 type of beer (which was so bad my husband refused to drink it... ) and red/white wines and good deals on food. Don't expect a "normal" drink though at a happy hour price. Internet access is not free. Not many "amenities" per se, but all in all a very quaint hotel that was convenient.
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel in convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very thrilled to get a reservation at this hotel. We wanted to be able to walk to most of the popular restaurants, bars and shops so we could just leave our car. The rooms are very clean and very charming! The lobby is elegant. The staff is very attentive, warm and friendly :) We walked to the pearl district, powel's books, and some very cool pubs and breweries. I will stay here again if we ever get a chance without a doubt!!
reviews.title: Great service and great location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel deLuxe has a great movie theme, with pix of old movie scenes (kindly labeled for those of us who can't remember the stars). Excellent restaurant (huge breakfasts can be shared). Bar is ridiculously dark. Rooms are very, very small. If you're not going to spend a lot of time in the room, the hotel is good as it is pretty-centrally located to the downtown area where you can catch public trains and trolleys to see the city. We walked and took public transportation all over the place.
reviews.title: Super friendly staff in a very friendly city!
Two thumbs up!
reviews.text: I hosted a dinner event for 30 people at Hotel deLuxe and stayed here as well. Can't say enough about the venue and the service. The best in the Pacific Northwest!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My sister and I were town for a wedding, and a friend recommended the Hotel deLuxe. Honestly, this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in over the past 10 years, and given the level of luxury, it was VERY affordable.
reviews.title: Definitely Coming Back to Hotel deLuxe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was small, but the bed was uber comfy and the space was very stylish. The entire hotel was beautiful, and I loved the classic Hollywood theme--we stayed on the Hitchcock floor.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, stylish. No problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The service was GREAT--the staff was so helpful and attentive, sending up extra robes, helping us pick a place for dinner, getting us a cab to the wedding, etc. Our flight got in late Friday night, but we made it to the Driftwood for happy hour: loved the champagne cocktails and the food was very tasty. The bartender was so friendly too! I liked my sister's cocktail better than mine so he replaced mine for free, and he had a great selection of single malts.
reviews.title: Perfect little jewel box of a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really enjoyed my stay. Location was great - Portland is a very small city so getting around the downtown was super easy and fast. Maybe a 1 mile walk to the river is all. Pearl district to the north a 5 minute walk.
reviews.title: Great little boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room is small, train passes below and can be noisy, as were the people slamming their doors in the hallway. Could hear the guy in the next room peeing in his toilet.
reviews.title: Hotel deLuxe - Exceptional facilities, staff, and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Classic old downtown hotel feel while being very clean and quaint. Most downtown hotels I've been in are old mildewy and gross. This place is top notch, but certainly not luxury.
reviews.title: Classic but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Not merely a hotel but an experience !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has been several years now since I have bothered to try any hotel in Portland other than Hotel deLuxe. The quality of this place, coupled with its affordability, makes it a no-brainer for me. The staff is overall quite possibly the most capable of any hotel I've stayed at, the rooms are always spotless, and the proximity to all the Pearl District has to offer makes it a great place to stay for both business and pleasure. Also, the Driftwood is one of the sexier places in town to have a cocktail or three! Also worth noting is the ridiculously comfortable beds! Makes waking up for a business meeting fairly impossible, but that's a good problem to have.
reviews.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The classic Hollywood theme is fresh and interesting, the beds were excellent (including a choice of seven kinds of pillows), the food was distinctive and delicious, and all the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. I've never had a better hotel experience.
reviews.title: Absolutely first-rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very lovely hotel with a cinematic theme. This old classic has been renovated in a charming manner. The beds were amazingly comfortable and the pillows come in a variety of densities. Pretty much can walk I guess but we had our bikes and went on some really great rides down the river and over to the other neighbourhoods on both sides of the river and up the hills/mountains around. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about all we asked. Portland is great for eating, so go explore and use this place as your comfort retreat!
reviews.title: Fabulous comfort in luxurious style!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good service, better location than downtown. The room was on the small side. I tripped and busted my azz (in the middle of the night) on the step up to the bathroom, but I should have remembered. Had a much better room last year. The beds are a bit soft (for me) but overall a good time was had by all.
reviews.title: Sweet Spot Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After a long drive, Hotel Deluxe in Portland was the perfect stop to relax and recharge. The service especially stands out. From the moment we arrived the valet attendees were incredibly nice and also when we left offered us cold bottles of water for the road. The room was larger than expected and had soothing music playing when we entered. Additionally, not only was there a "Pillow menu" but also an "Ipod menu" which we had never seen before (if you forgot/don't have one they will deliver one to your room with arranged playlists). Overall, exceeded our expectations and next time we visit Portland we will only stay at Hotel Deluxe!
reviews.title: Great night at Hotel Deluxe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Hotel DeLuxe was the hotel my daughter chose for housing all the out-of-town guests for her wedding, and the staff there are absolutely the best! The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the food in the restaurant was good, room service was prompt, but the best thing about this hotel is the quality of the people it hires. Thank you, thank you, sweet people, for taking such good care of a stressed-out mom.
reviews.title: Greatest hotel staff ever
